stream_context.summary: Kaze brainstorms, models and debugs two areas: the brand-new Course 15 “Space Arcade” and a re-worked Bomb-Cap factory.  He sketches star missions, tweaks visual style, reviews Biobak’s level update, fixes texture and collision bugs and chases a persistent crash.

development_findings.summary: Mario’s entire animation system was rewritten for consistency, though the change is purely in code and not yet visible.
development_findings.quote: I overhauled Mario's animation system. Mario's animations are now much more consistent.

development_findings.summary: Course 15 will be a giant rocket-shaped space arcade (not a casino) with a spiral interior, a black-hole void below, and platforming over space.
development_findings.quote: A giant rocket that's the casino... inside the rocket there's going to be like a spiral thing that goes up with a black hole at the bottom.

development_findings.summary: Proposed six main stars for Course 15: (1) reach rocket top, (2) whack-a-mole machine, (3) rhythm game, (4) skee-ball cannon into slide, (5) space pinball inspired by Sonic’s Casino Night, (6) bit-pipe leading to miniature Mario 64 diorama.
Bit-pipe diorama will show short, beautified fragments of classic SM64 stages (e.g., Bob-omb Battlefield, Jolly Roger Bay) to contrast RTYI’s modern visuals.
development_findings.quote: The contrast between Mario 64 levels and RTYI levels is going to be beautiful at display here.

development_findings.summary: Extra Yoshi-coin machines include Star Fox-lite shooter, ‘hit-the-lights’ window game, pixel-art floor that lights when walked, Simon-style memory path and scam machine concepts.
Visual direction experiments: darker skybox, glowing rainbow/bloom platforms, ugly arcade carpets, giant CRTs usable as walkable surfaces, scrolling-texture pixel billboards.
development_findings.quote: Pixel arts of characters that light up with scrolling textures... I'm going to make a better version of that.

development_findings.summary: Fast64 exporter shows a tile-size bug: a 32×128 wall decal renders doubled; workaround is manual UV shift, and Kaze will file a bug report.
development_findings.quote: Definitely a Fast64 bug, right? I'm not insane here.

development_findings.summary: Persistent crash traced to actor/collision overflow in Bomb-Cap level; Kaze reduces collision triangles from 5 500 to 3 900 and tests by selectively removing objects, suspecting producers and wall gears.
development_findings.quote: I'm just going to take out one type of object at a time... We might have an actor overflow here.

development_findings.summary: Bomb-Cap factory rework (by Biobak) now has: extended start platform, round pillars, toxic vents, catwalks, treadmills with bomb producers, seven-segment countdown, sliding ceiling rails, overhead lighting and hidden coin rooms.
Kaze plans a low-gravity gimmick—green ‘boxes’ that halve gravity when entered—and a mandatory bombable wall near the exit to teach the Bomb-Cap ability.
development_findings.quote: I still want the player to get the immediate feedback of like, okay, I can blow up walls now.

development_findings.summary: Engine upgrades let RTYI handle larger, more complex geometry and improved physics compared with vanilla SM64, despite N64 limits.
development_findings.quote: You can have crazy geometry in this engine and it's going to perform better than the vanilla engine.

development_findings.summary: Project overall: 15 main courses confirmed; after Course 15 remain overworld, Bowser stage and two side courses.

context_findings.summary: Refused to sign new ISP contract after installer lied and pre-installed hardware; views it as their loss.
context_findings.quote: I didn't sign anything... Now they have the router in our basement. I'm not paying for that.

context_findings.summary: Believes wild ideas are essential: "You need to have crazy ideas," but they must still fit game consistency.
context_findings.quote: If something is so different from the rest of the game... you're going to limit the amount of players that enjoy your game.

context_findings.summary: States making one’s bed and listening to classical music are identity signals, not real productivity or intelligence; values practical efficiency.
context_findings.quote: Making your bed is not a productive people thing... you're wasting time of your day to make the bed worse.

context_findings.summary: Feels large studios would stifle his speed and creative control; prefers indie autonomy over joining Nintendo.
context_findings.quote: In a big company everything is much slower... I wouldn't be able to just make a full game.

context_findings.summary: Critiques Twilight Princess as feeling unfinished, citing rushed story beats and missing polish.
context_findings.quote: I have a crazy theory about Twilight Princess and that is that the game is unfinished.

context_findings.summary: Mentions upcoming days off (Mon/Tue) and possible bonus streams, hinting at personal schedule flexibility.
Lighthearted domestic note: Zeina sometimes makes the bed; he jokingly dislikes the result.
context_findings.quote: Zaina sometimes makes the bed and every time she makes the bed it's like you made it worse.

biobak.summary: Originated the giant-rocket space-arcade concept for Course 15.
Delivered major Bomb-Cap level update: new textures, lighting, removed cranes, added catwalks, toxic vents, sliding rails, rounded pillars and countdown display.
biobak.quote: Square pillars are now round... Seven segment counter in the center displays time left before door opens.

badub.summary: Minimal presence; Kaze asked for OST ideas, rejected ‘Liam song’ but accepted Origami King track; implies Badub will compose accordingly.

zeina.summary: No project work mentioned; only casual reference to her making the bed at home.

key_stories.title: The Unsigned Router
key_stories.summary: A salesman offered cheaper internet, installed hardware before paperwork, and left a router in Kaze’s basement without a contract.
key_stories.challenge: Installer tried to lock him into a worse connection by pre-installing equipment.
key_stories.process: Kaze refused to sign, let them finish, and kept the router.
key_stories.outcome: He has the hardware without paying and considers it the installer’s fault.
key_stories.key_quote: I'm not signing shit... Now we have the router. I'm not paying for that.

key_stories.title: Fast64 Texture Mystery
key_stories.summary: A wall decal in Bomb-Cap level rendered doubled due to a Fast64 exporter bug.
key_stories.challenge: Texture appeared stretched and mis-aligned in game, causing visual errors.
key_stories.process: Tested tile-size shifts, inspected display list, confirmed exporter bug, filed note to report.
key_stories.outcome: Temporary UV workaround lets level proceed; formal bug report planned.
key_stories.key_quote: Definitely a Fast64 bug, right? I'm not insane here.

key_stories.title: Course 15 Star Brainstorm
key_stories.summary: Kaze struggled with palette and structure until listing six arcade-themed stars and darkening the sky.
key_stories.challenge: Level felt directionless and color palette ‘poopy’.
key_stories.process: Outlined star ideas, added darker background, noted ugly arcade carpet and CRT platforms.
key_stories.outcome: Clear mission list and visual direction established for Space Arcade.
key_stories.key_quote: I have too many ideas for this level... The color palette is just kind of poopy.

open_questions.context: Kaze said he rewrote Mario’s animation system for consistency but showed no details.
questions: What concrete problems did the old animation state machine have?
What technical approach did you use for the new system?
How does it change player feel or modder workflow?

open_questions.context: Kaze envisions green boxes that halve gravity in Bomb-Cap level.
questions: How will the gravity field be implemented within N64 limits?
Will the mechanic appear elsewhere or just this level?
How will players learn its effect?

open_questions.context: Level still crashes after collision reductions; exact culprit unclear.
questions: Have you isolated which object combination tips the memory limit?
Will engine changes raise actor limits or require design compromises?
How will testing guard against similar overflows in other stages?

open_questions.topic: Final color palette for Space Arcade
open_questions.context: Kaze is unhappy with current palette and glow approach.
questions: What reference materials or tests will decide the final palette?
Is Biobak leading palette choices or is it collaborative?
How will bloom/glow be balanced with N64 performance?

open_questions.context: Kaze confirmed remaining tasks (hub, Bowser, side levels) but no timeline.
